author: Special Correspondent
text:
We have asked for consular access, says Defence Minister

Defence Minister Manohar Parrikar on Monday said the government would provide all support to the former Naval officer arrested on the charge of spying in Pakistan.

Replying to a question during a press conference at DefExpo 2016, Mr. Parrikar said that though the officer had retired and was not under the direct control of the Defence Ministry, the government would ensure that he was given proper treatment.

“You have said that he is an ex-naval officer. Other than paying him OROP pension I cannot talk about ex-officers because I have no control over them,” said Mr. Parrikar. “But we do agree that he is an Indian citizen and therefore we have asked for consular access.”
title: Parrikar offers all help to ‘spy’ held in Pakistan
